    • Method Detail

      • loadItems

        public void loadItems(Item[] items,
                      EnumItemType type)
               throws InventoryException
        Sets the inventory's item array to another item array.
        Example: 
         Inventory inv = unit.getInventory();
 int invLength = inv.lenght();
 Item[] newInventory = new Item[invLength];
 // Load items into the array
 try {
        inv.loadItems(newInventory, EnumItemType.Potion);
 } catch (InventoryException e) {
        // Handle the error.
 }
        Parameters:
        items - The new array of items to become the inventory
        type - The inventory type
        Throws:
        InventoryException - If the size of the parameter items does not match the inventory's length

      • setItem

        public void setItem(int index,
                    Item item,
                    EnumItemType type)
             throws InventoryException
        Sets an item in the inventory at a given index (of the given type) to a given item.
        Example: 
         Item i = ... //get the item in some way
 unit.getInventory().setItem(i.getInventorySlot(), new Item(...), EnumItemType.Potion);
        Parameters:
        index - Index for setting
        item - The new item
        type - The inventory type
        Throws:
        InventoryException - Thrown if the index is over the intended array's bounds

      • getItem

        public Item getItem(int index,
                    EnumItemType type)
        Gets an item from the inventory at the given index (of the given type).
        Example usage: 
         Item heldItem = unit.getInventory().getItem(0, EnumItemType.Potion)); 
 if (heldItem != null){
 //code Here
 }
        Parameters:
        index -
        type - The inventory type
        Returns:
        Returns null if type is not valid

      • getItems

        public Item[] getItems(EnumItemType type)
        Returns the array of items of the given type in the inventory.
        Example usage: 
         for (Item item : unit.getInventory().getItems(EnumItemType.Potion)) {
        // Item slots not filled will be null
        if (item == null)
                continue;
        // code here
 }
        Returns:
        Returns null if type is not valid

      • length

        public int length(EnumItemType type)
        Returns the length of the inventory array.
        Parameters:
        type - The inventory type
        Returns:
        Returns -1 if type is not valid
